string.text: Improved buttstock
Replacing the buttstock with a softer, padded alternative mitigates recoil slightly better.
Sawn-off stock
Removing the majority of the stock makes the weapon considerably lighter and easier to handle, however recoil is much more pronounced.
Tritium inserts
Installation of luminous night-sights allows for easier target acquisition in low-light conditions.
Sawn-off barrel
Sawing off the barrel results in a much lighter and easier-to-handle weapon, but range and accuracy are impacted significantly.
Calibrate the trigger group
Precision adjustment and balancing of the trigger components allows for higher accuracy and reduced recoil.
Barrel revisioning
The complex modification results in a higher muzzle velocity and improved wear-resistance.
Lightweight forend
Replacing the forend with a lightweight alternative reduces the overall weight of the weapon.
Titanium hinge
Replace the break-action's hinge mechanism with a heavy-duty titanium alternative, which significantly improves its durability.
Replacement trigger
Minimizes the chances of a misfire from insufficient chambering.
Framework rebalancing
A comprehensive modification that affects almost every part of the gun, with a noticeable improvement on accuracy and recoil.
Rifled barrel
Rifling the barrel significantly improves accuracy and muzzle velocity, but prevents any further use of buckshot ammunition.
Protective coating
The application of a special coating to the moving components can significantly reduce the amount of wear they receive.
